sentences.english: This is a boutique project for "karis" in a shopping center in Hiroshima.

sentences.english: Akiba sent a video greeting in the similar spirit.
sentences.chinese: 廣島市長秋葉忠利在錄象中也表示了同樣的觀點。

sentences.english: Hiroshima took nine seconds; Changchun took five months.
sentences.chinese: 廣島用了九秒鐘，長春用了五個月。

sentences.english: Why is memory thwarted in Hiroshima?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼在廣島記憶受到窒礙？

sentences.chinese: 2003年於日本廣島大學獲博士學位。

sentences.english: The analysis shows that black rain fell most extensively after 10 a.m. on Aug. 6, two hours after the bomb was dropped.
sentences.chinese: 分析數據表明廣島原子爆炸兩小時後黑雨的範圍甚廣。

sentences.english: The atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima had a yield of20 kilotons .
sentences.chinese: 落在廣島的原子彈產生出二萬噸的當量。

sentences.english: Today marks the 65th anniversary of the dropping of the Atomic Bomb on Hiroshima.
sentences.chinese: 今天是廣島原子彈爆炸65週年紀念日。

sentences.english: the pitch of rights, and a little bit about Hiroshima.
sentences.chinese: 例如安保條約，還有廣島。

sentences.english: In spite of its Hiroshima-sized blast this week.
sentences.chinese: 雖然上週的核爆炸威力堪比廣島。

sentences.english: Ann: I will go to Hiroshima in Tokyo instead.
The Japanese city of Hiroshima is marking the 65th anniversary of the world's first atomic bomb attack.
sentences.chinese: 日本廣島市正在舉行原子彈爆炸65週年紀念。

sentences.english: Because if I remember, there were only two planes over Hiroshima.
sentences.chinese: 如果我還記得，在廣島上空盤旋的有兩架飛機。
